An integrator can use this endpoint to get the exchange rate between two fiat currencies
post.summary: Get Fiat to Fiat exchange rate

post.description: Get a rate quote for crypto bridge transactions (fiat to crypto conversion). This endpoint generates a rate_id that must be used in the crypto bridge deposit request. Rate is valid for 60 seconds and can only be used once. Currently supports: KES -> Lightning (MSAT)

message.example: Crypto bridge rate quote generated successfully.

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to get all the exchange rates available
Public endpoint for getting exchange rates between two currencies. Used for payment link checkout currency conversion display.
get.summary: Get public exchange rate (no auth required)

get.description: Public endpoint for getting all available exchange rates. Useful for dropdown displays or rate comparison.
get.summary: Get all public exchange rates (no auth required)

message.example: The wallet has been successfully retrieved.

get.summary: Get Integrator Fiat Wallet by Currency (optionally by Country)

post.description: This endpoint will transfer the deposit balance of the fiat wallet to the main balance.

message.example: Transfer deposit balance has been successfully done.

post.description: The crypto wallet will contain the specified chain and coins an integrator desires to hold and one can create as many wallets as needed.

post.description: An integrators customers can initiate a deposit from their respective mobile money wallets.     An STK push will be sent to the customer and the respective amount will be deducted from their mobile money wallets and deposited into the integrators fiat wallet

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to check the status of a deposit
get.summary: Get Deposit on Mobile Money status

post.description: Customer Completed transaction using Checkout Url

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to check the status of a deposit

post.description: Customer Completed transaction using Checkout Url

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to check the status of a deposit

post.description: Crypto deposits are where a customer's mobile money wallet account is deducted a specific fiat amount which is then converted to a specified stablecoin amount and sent to the integrator's specified public wallet address.

get.description: This endpoint will be used to get the status of the deposit onchain request
This endpoint will be used to get the supported chains for deposit onchain

message.example: Deposit onchain supported chains retrieved successfully.

post.description: Enables cross-border transactions using blockchain as settlement rail. Provider initiates the transaction with a pre-generated payment invoice. Flow: Fiat collection  Crypto payment  Settlement to recipient. Supports Lightning Network, Solana, Base, Ethereum, and other chains. Supports mobile money and bank transfer settlements.

get.description: Retrieve detailed status of a crypto bridge transaction including all stages: deposit collection, crypto payment, and settlement.

parameters.name: kotani_reference_id
parameters.description: Kotani reference ID for the transaction

post.description: Receives settlement status updates from settlement provider. Requires signature validation. Statuses: SETTLING, COMPLETED, FAILED. For FAILED status, initiates refund process using configured refund method.
post.summary: Webhook endpoint for provider settlement status updates

post.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to create the customers who will be either receiving or sending money using mobile money.

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to get all the customers who will be either receiving or sending money using mobile money.

patch.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to update the customers who will be either receiving or sending money using mobile money.

message.example: Bio Data has been successfully updated.

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to get the customer who will be either receiving or sending money using mobile money by passing customer key.
get.summary: Get a mobile money customer by customer key

get.description: An integrator can use this endpoint to get the customer who will be either receiving or sending money using mobile money by passing phone number.
get.summary: Get a mobile money customer by Phone

post.description: Validates a phone number in any format (with or without country code). Returns validation status, country information, formatted number, and whether the country is supported for mobile money.
Validates a bank account number format for a given country and bank code. Returns validation status, bank information, and whether the country is supported.
This api will withdraw fiat from the integrators fiat wallet to the customers mobile money wallet.
Send money from integrator wallet to customer via Lipa na M-Pesa STK Push or to a business shortcode.

message.example: Lipa na M-Pesa withdrawal has been successfully created.

post.description: Send money from integrator wallet to a Paybill number with account reference.

message.example: Paybill withdrawal has been successfully created.

post.description: Send money from integrator wallet to customer bank account. Supports Kenya and SA

message.example: Bank withdrawal has been successfully created.

get.description: This endpoint will return the status of the withdrawal request.

post.description: This Api Handles fetching of payment providers
This Api Handles payout to bank, currently only supports SA Banks

post.description: This api will create a new kyc basic details
This api will create a new kyc address
This api will create a new kyc document

get.description: This api will get kyc status
This api will get all integrator kyc users

Returns a list of all supported countries with their configurations. Supports filtering by service type, currency, country code, and active status. Data is aggregated from the Provider Registry for real-time accuracy. The isEnabled flag indicates whether the authenticated integrator has this service enabled and providers attached.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Filter by country code (e.g., KE, NG, GH)

get.description: Returns comprehensive details about a specific country including supported currencies, networks, and service availability. The isEnabled flag indicates whether the authenticated integrator has each service enabled and providers attached.
Returns all active mobile money networks available in a specific country, aggregated from all providers. Indicates if network selection is required.
get.summary: Get available networks for a country

get.description: Returns a list of all supported banks with optional filtering by currency or search term. Banks are sourced from the centralized bank data registry.
Returns all countries that support deposit (onramp) services with their configurations.
Returns all countries that support withdraw (offramp) services with their configurations.
This endpoint is used to check for the health of the application

503.description: The Health Check is not successful

post.description: This endpoint will create a offramp request for a customer. If the fiat transfer fails after successful crypto receipt, an automatic refund will be initiated after 5 minutes. Use the refund-status endpoint to check refund status.

get.description: This endpoint will return all offramp transactions for the integrator.
This endpoint will return the status of the withdrawal request.
This endpoint will cancel the offramp transaction.
Get the status of an onchain refund. Refunds are automatically initiated 5 minutes after a failed transaction if the crypto was successfully received but fiat transfer failed.

post.description: Retry a failed crypto refund for an offramp transaction. Gas/fund errors can be retried up to 10 times, other errors up to 4 times. Refunds marked for manual intervention cannot be retried through this endpoint.

Retry multiple failed crypto refunds by providing an array of reference IDs. Gas/fund errors can be retried up to 10 times, other errors up to 4 times. Refunds marked for manual intervention will be skipped.

referenceIds.description: Array of offramp transaction reference IDs to retry

post.description: Retry all failed refunds that are eligible for retry. This excludes refunds that are permanently failed (requiresManualIntervention). Contact support if you need to retry refunds marked for manual intervention.

Submit a Lightning bolt11 invoice to receive refund for a failed Lightning offramp. The invoice must be for the exact refund amount, must not be expired, and must not already be paid. This endpoint is only applicable for Lightning (bolt11) offramp transactions where the crypto was received but fiat transfer failed.

invoice.description: Lightning bolt11 invoice for the refund. Must match the exact refund amount.

message.example: Invalid invoice or not eligible for Lightning refund

source_amount.description: Source fiat amount customer will pay

primary_method.description: Primary refund method - How should the provider return crypto to Kotani

token.description: Token for refund (same as transaction token)

refund_invoice.description: Kotani refund invoice (for Lightning) - the provider pays this if settlement fails

payment_hash.description: Payment hash for tracking crypto transaction

refund_config.description: Refund configuration - the provider must pay this invoice/address if settlement fails to return crypto to Kotani

phone_number.description: Recipient phone number (required for all payment methods)

rate_id.description: Rate ID from /rate/crypto-bridge endpoint. Optional but recommended. Validates fiat->crypto conversion rate. Rate expires in 60 seconds.

customer_key.description: Customer key (Provider customer ID in Kotani system)

wallet_id.description: Kotani wallet ID to use for transaction

crypto_payment.description: Crypto payment details (pre-generated invoice or address)

stages.description: Detailed status of each transaction stage

refund_details.description: Refund details (if failed and refund initiated)
